column4: Excuse me, can anyone tell me how I can possibly change my accounts privileges? Sometimes I like to open up text files to edit them in GEdit, but unfortunately I can't because I don't have enough permission. I'm just wondering so I don't have to do it through the terminal all the time.
as root you can change the mode of the file
I know.. but.. I mean in the GUI
uh, i dont use gui, a whole lot
right click on the file, and go to properties
if you want to use linux efficiently, learn the terminal, thats what 80 percent of linux is about
the windows in you wants the GUI, you gotta just forget it
probably not, but you can accidently delete important things and not even know it
thats the best way to learn :) just open up the shell and mess around, move files around, pipe stuff to Grep, learn to use it efficiently
save the mouse some wear and tear, plus it's faster thru the terminal with tab completion, at least to me
by default, you should have an ftp program at the terminal
where host is the host you're ftping too, of course, its all at the terminal and gets annoying, so just use GFTP
